isis.stitle: ALLISON WT TRANSMISSION ELECTRONIC CONTROLS - ELECTRICAL OPERATION - WILLIAMS BLUE OX ENGINE BRAKE OPERATION

svcproc.title: WILLIAMS BLUE OX ENGINE BRAKE OPERATION

svcsubproc.title: Engine Brake Operation

step1.para: The engine brake ON/OFF switch. The switch is a two-pole, single throw switch. One pole provides the input signal (spare input) to the WT ECU and the other pole completes the circuit to the exhaust brake air solenoid.
The exhaust brake air solenoid (normally closed - closed when voltage is not applied).
The special function output relay #4 (SF-4) located in the VIM.

The Williams Blue Ox exhaust brake is activated by turning the engine brake switch ON. Closing the on/off switch completes the circuit between ECU terminal B29 (signal source) and ECU terminal B27 (signal ground). This tells the WT ECU that the engine brake switch is ON. The WT ECU will then determine:

step2.para: When the throttle is closed (using the throttle position sensor information).
When the transmission is in lockup mode of operation.

step1.para: When these two conditions are present, a user-specified preselected shift schedule will go into effect and the spare function relay #4 (SF-4) will be energized (WT ECU ground switch closes grounding SF-4 relay circuit 125), which delivers power to energize the exhaust brake solenoid and apply air pressure to the engine brake system.

svcsubproc.title: Exhaust Brake System Circuit Operation
svcsubproc.para: The circuit operation of the exhaust brake system is as follows:

step1.para: When the key is ON, ignition voltage from fuse F2 is applied to SF-4 relay, terminal 30. Ignition voltage is also applied from the IGN fuse (located in VIM) to SF-4 relay, terminal 86.

The engine brake ON/OFF switch is a two-pole switch. With the Engine Brake ON/OFF switch in the ON position (as shown in circuit diagram), it signals to the WT ECU that the engine brake is in the ON position by closing the circuit between ECU terminals B29 (signal) and B27 (signal ground).
The other pole of the engine brake ON/OFF switch (in the ON position) completes the path between SF-4 relay (terminal 87) and the exhaust brake air solenoid.

The SF-4 relay is energized when a ground switch located in the ECU closes (when the conditions discussed earlier are present). With the relay energized, voltage from F2 fuse goes through the relay (terminal 30 to 87) then through the engine brake ON/OFF switch and to the exhaust brake air solenoid.
